name: Maria
headline: The best apartment!
pros: Everything!!
cons: The staff does not answer via booking.

name: Steven
headline: Very good
pros: Clean and comfortable.

name: Trevor
headline: Great location above a proper London Pub.
pros: Great location above an excellent pub, friendly staff and a good vibe.
cons: My first time in Room 4 and the bed was terrible, I will not stay in this room again. Springs are gone and I kept rolling to the middle of the bed and did not sleep well.

name: Iwan
headline: very very comfortable
pros: it was very cozy. the staff were all very helpful and very kind. the location was in the middle of the city.
cons: my only complaint would be that the main lights didn’t work, but we weren’t bothered because of all the other factors of it being so good

name: Jos
headline: Passable
pros: The room was nice but very clod .windows did no close . The heating provide was not adequate. Milk provided was  out of date
cons: Staff were excellent ,room was specious  but very cold

name: Mandy
headline: Windowless overnight stay.
pros: Comfy bed. Spacious room.
cons:
No window, which I didn't know. Noisy pub downstairs but ear plugs helped.
Tiny shower.

name: Antony
headline: Pub with rooms a short walk from Lambeth North tube
pros: Good location for connections in the Lambeth area, close to Waterlook and Lambeth North tube stations. Simple setup, friendly staff, and Nespresso coffee in the rooms.
cons: Bed was not very comfortable, and the room was draughty and a bit noisy from the street due to the original windows. Got very cold in the night (in February) as the heating didn't seem to work.

name: Jen
headline: One of my worst hotel choices in London.
pros: the bed sheet were very white and clean.  That is all I can think to say that is positive about this property.
cons:
Location was a long walk with my case from the tube station. 

 nothing much in the area for eating either, which was particularly tricky as the wait at the property for a pizza was over 2 hours due to staff shortages. despite being an overnight guest I was not given preferential service. 

Room was freezing cold, ALL night.  and i mean cold like outside.  

upstairs in the property wreaked of cigarette smoke. 

Bathroom window didn't shut at the bottom which allowed more cold in.   

Room was 'shabby' at best, the bathroom sink had no plug so you could see right down the (rather manky) pipe and which also allowed a load of 'trash' flies into the bathroom.  Disgusting.  

Bedroom carpet was manky.  Paint chipped and peeling throughout.  

coffee machine but no milk provided, i would have preferred milk to the packets of love hearts. 

was hastily shown to my room when I arrived but no guidance given on keys/front doors keys etc.  staff were simply too buys downstairs in the pub to offer a proper welcome.  very poor.

name: Kirill
headline: Staying for 1-2 nights definitely worth it
pros: Nice and cozy place. We room was on second floor, so it was quite. All listed facilities were in the room
cons: Low frequency buzzing at night. Maybe fridge or some boiler. Not too loud but it was quite annoying. Nevertheless this is not a showstopper.

name: Scott
headline: Exceptional
pros: The room was lovely and cosy, perfect for the cosiest sleep. The coffee and tea station was perfect and we'll stocked. I ha e truly have no complaint I will definitely be looking at book here again next time I am in London.

name: Tatiana
headline: Good
pros: Dinner in the pub and pub staff were great
cons: The cleaner in the morning was purposefully trying to wake us up one over hour before check out and making a lot of noise even when we asked her not to disturb us. We found this very disturbing and rude

name: Lucy
headline: Great value and location
pros: Comfy bed, nice room, lovely staff and pub. Location is fantastic. Surprisingly quiet for the middle of London, we got a great night's sleep. Everything for a nice cup of coffee or tea provided.
cons: Room is a little tired, and a reminder there are a few stairs. But nothing major. Considering price excellent value for money.

name: Kenneth
headline: Very friendly staff good atmosphere in the bar and great fresh pizza
pros: Centrally positioned for our purposes
cons: Old style building

name: Otoikhine
headline: Value for money for my 1-night stay
pros: Just perfect for a 1-night stay. Nice location and very welcoming staff.

name: Stuart
headline: A Good value stay south of Waterloo.
pros: Pleasant enough for an over night in London about 15 mins walk from Waterloo.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Top floor room was clean, a reasonable size and I slept pretty well. Towels were good with decent toiletries in the bathroom and water/milk was available for making beverages.
cons: The Mattress was pretty thin, the sink didn't drain properly and the Shower was on its last legs.

name: Damon
headline: Perfect Location - Great Stay
pros: Great location, close to underground’s. We were riding the 10th Santa Cruise and it was easy to get to Waterloo for the start. Quiet as well being in a residential area so we had a good sleep. Don’t be put off with it being above a pub as we didn’t hear anything. Staff are very friendly in the pub and you get a discount being a resident. So glad we found the Ship Rooms as we will definitely be back. Rooms are lovely.
cons: Nothing, all was good.

name: Becca
headline: Great pub and super comfy bed!! A shame about the fire alarm…
pros: A really lovely room in a cosy little pub - the bed is SO comfortable! The shower was lovely too, and the little jar of sweets was a lovely touch!
cons: The only comments I’d make is that the lights are really low so it’s actually really dark during these winter days/evenings and it would be great to have another couple of lamps, and we didn’t have any milk for the tea. Also, the fire alarm went off at 3.30am which was a shock, and we were unsure what to do (other than vacate the property!)… but would still stay here again 😊

name: Romina
headline: Comfortable and enjoyable.
pros: Friendly and helpful staff. Tea and coffee facilities. Roomy.
cons: It was a little noisy but it was the Christmas period. So to be expected.

name: Joyce
headline: Good location and comfortable stay
pros:
Central location
Clean and comfortable
Good supply of coffee and tea
cons: There is no 24hrs concierge, there was a fire alarm at 3am and no one responsible around to check. The fire truck arrived in 10 mins and took care of it, don’t know if it was a drill or something actually happened. All of us were just told to go back in. Was disturbing in the middle of the night especially with no one from the property to guide us

name: Nicola
headline: Good
pros: Great location and very polite and friendly staff.
cons:
Room was cold and drafty at night, heater didn't work, luckily it was a small room so did manage to keep in some heat in.
Great coffee facilities, however we had to share a fridge in the hallway with milk in and after first few hours that disappeared, we never saw it again and it wasn't replenished for the duration of our stay.

name: J
headline: Superb
pros: Great pub - good range of drinks, friendly staff and a good pizzas. Room was very comfortable and stylish. Main road a little bit noisy but it didn't bother me too much. Would definitely stay again.

name: Dawn
headline: Good value, clean accommodation ideal for 1 night for 1 traveller
pros: Warm, cosy room with a good-sized ensuite bathroom. Great for 1 night's stay and ideal for a lone traveller.
cons: The fridge in the communal cubby area has a powerful motor that causes vibrations in the guest room, as do the fans in the adjacent guest bathrooms.

name: Justinefancy
headline: Nice room in a good pub in south London
pros: Lovely room with nice decor in a good location in south London
cons: The mattress was a little hard on the bed and the bathroom is in need of an update. The shower was shooting water from the hose and soaked the floor and the window didn't close properly.

name: Triinu
headline: Good
pros: Good location, great price, very clean, wifi worked nicely, anything for making tea or coffee in room, very comfortable bed
cons: Room was dark, too dark. Not even enough light to read a book. Needed to use my phone as a torch

name: Angeliki
headline: I’d stay again!
pros: The location was great, near main attractions in 20-minute walking and 2 underground stations in 10-minute walking. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We really loved the coffee and tea offered inside the room and the common bottles of water and milk.
cons: The water in the shower was not very hot (or at least we were not informed how to heat it up). Also when we were offered cleaning of the room for more than 3 nights stay, we just asked for trash to be taken out, but it never happened. One more thing that we were not happy about were the too many steps to climb up to the room in a very narrow staircase, so carrying the suitcases was a challenge

name: Wendy
headline: Great stay at great price so close to main attractions
pros: Great location 15 mins walk from Waterloo Station. We stayed in room 7 so no noise from the pub. We liked that we could open the window as the room was very warm as the heating was on (we stayed November). Bed was comfortable and bedding was clean and soft. Lovely pub although we didn’t use it. Good tea and coffee making facilities with fresh milk available. Shower had good pressure. Price was very good as access to central London was so easy. Would stay again.
cons: Decor was a bit tired and could use a lick of paint. Fridge in the room wasn’t very effective but not really an issue as we could use the shared fridge.

name: Simon
headline: Good value option
pros:
Good value and 15 mins walk from Waterloo
Good to get your own private bathroom at this price
cons: Everything was fine

name: J'amy
headline: Charming hotel with super friendly staff in a great location. Will definitely come back!
pros: Charming hotel with lots of character and the friendliest, helpful staff. The rooms are roomy (uncommon in London) with great coffee makers plus a milk frother and fresh milk/oat milk. Easy walk to buses and the underground. Friendly pub with good pizza. Will happily stay here again!
cons: Could use a little more light in the rooms.

name: Trevor
headline: Excellent location above a proper English pub.
pros: No breakfast available.
cons: Rooms need a bit of tlc....carpets are creased,  mould in shower and shower drain blocked.
